title: Messages can still be seen on conversation after expiring when cron is misconfigured

profile.name: Nextcloud
profile.about: Access, share and protect your files, calendars, contacts, communication & more at home and in your enterprise.

vulnerability_information:
## Summary:
Nextcloud talk has a feature called ```Message Expiration```, Chat messages can be expired after a certain time. However the message  does not really expire and can still be seen by anyone.

## Steps To Reproduce:

1. Create a conversation
1. Set the message expiration Go to Settings > Moderation 
1. Pick anything and using burp intercept the request and set it to 60 or 120 seconds.
1. send a message
1. wait for the message to expire
1. Copy the conversation link and open it to a new tab


## Supporting Material/References:
[list any additional material (e.g. screenshots, logs, etc.)]

 ██████████

## Impact

Messages that should expired is divulged to anyone that can access the conversation, This includes personal and group.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.

First of all thanks for your report.

However, there are multiple issue to it.

1. First of all a value below 1h is not supported hence there is no UI option to add such a duration. The reason for this is: 2.
2. In order for messages to be removed from the database, the cron jobs need to be executed, which I assume is not the case on your localhost instance. With webcron and Ajax cron it is not reliable enough to support values below 1h and with system cron the job also a value below 5 minutes can not be guaranteed.
3. The UI has a interval set that should delete expired messages from the local store and view. The pull request for that is at https://github.com/nextcloud/spreed/pull/7918

Did you make any further changes which would prevent the deletion?

As per the setting description only new messages are bound to the expiration time. You can verify this by checking the expirationTimestamp attribute in your second screenshot. So it seems to work as expected there.

Interesting question why there is no fall back on the endpoint. We should add that. But that is more of a hardening.

Hello @nickvergessen,

Do we also have updates on this and #1781751?

The patch is at https://github.com/nextcloud/spreed/pull/8515
It is yet to be released which is why we didn't close the report here, but should happen next week.

Hi @nickvergessen 

Just  following up on this, I checked the update was released last week.

https://github.com/nextcloud/spreed/releases/tag/v15.0.3

Can we close this as resolved?

Sorry yeah, it should be closed. But we have too much paperwork in the backlog. Give us some more time.
We can only publish the advisory after 9th February anyway. (But I will be busy that week, so might be the Tuesday/Wednesday afterwards.

Thanks a lot for your report again. This has been resolved in our latest maintenance releases and we're working on the advisories at the moment.

If you have a GitHub account please let us know the username, and we will associate it with the advisory.

https://github.com/ctuihu

Is there also an update on #1781751?

Security advisory at https://github.com/nextcloud/security-advisories/security/advisories/GHSA-j53p-r755-v4jf

Feel free to review and accept the credit.

additional_data.old_title: [Spreed] Messages can still be seen on conversation after expiring
additional_data.new_title: Messages can still be seen on conversation after expiring when cron is misconfigured

activities.message:
Before disclosure can you censor the poc video? and also follow up for the bounty for #1781751 and this one.

Thanks!
